field_edited_text.value:
to construct and operate the building in Development Area 12.
These drawings and outline specifications shall include the fol-
lowing items only:

a. Site Plans

i. Rooftop plan, at 1'" = 50', showing relationship to adja-
cent streets and buildings. ‘

ii. Park level/ground lewvel plan, at 1/16'" = 1'0", showing
vehicular access andegress and sidewalks withadequate
spot elevations to ascertain proposed grading and sur-
face drainage. Paving materials and all proposed land-
scape development shall be clearly indicated. Coordi-
nation with adjacent Public Park elevations and designs.
shall be indicated. (see park plan on page 25). 2 7

b. Plans

i. Floor plans of a typical floor and of each non-typical
level, at 1/16" = 1'0", with adequate dimensioning and
indications to ascertain building coverage, major uses,
materials employed and circulation patterns. Simple
tabulations of net and gross floor areas, by use, should
appear with each floor plan.

ii. Roof plan, at 1/16'" = 1'0", indicating sizes, heights,
materials and finishes of all projecting elements above
roof surface (vents, fans, pipes, etc.).

c. Elevations

Each development elevation, at 1/16" = 1'0", with adequate
notes to make the design clear. Materials, colors and tex-
tures shall be explained in such a manner so that the panel
of judges may have a full understanding of the exterior
treatment and appearance. A vertical 'graphic scale shall
be placed alongside eachelevation drawing from the lowest
construction element to highest point of structures. It shall
be calibrated in terms of Mean Low Tide and shall specifi-
cally show governing heights as set forth in the Standards
and Controls.

d. Sections

i, Transverse sections through the entire development in
both north-south and east-west directions making clear
the structural system, major spaces and materials.

ii. Schematic sections through the vehicular ramps showing
ramp grades, connections and relationships to adjacent
street grades, if these arenot covered initem d.i.above.

iii. Selected details at appropriate scale in order to make
clear materials, sizes, finishes, color and construction.
Special attention shall be given to sections through a

23
